meaningMnemonic: When the <radical>sun</radical> gets in your <radical>eye</radical>, I <kanji>dare</kanji> you to stare at it. I dare you to look right at the sun. I dare you.
readingMnemonic: After you’ve blinded yourself from the <kanji>dare</kanji> of looking at the sun and losing sight in each eye, the guy dares you to go <reading>bow</reading>ling (ぼう). You’re blind now, so bowling will be quite the challenge.
